segments.pli: “Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū kuhā thaddhā lapā siṅgī unnaḷā asamāhitā, na me te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū māmakā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, those mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds, insolent, and scattered: they are no mendicants of mine.

segments.pli: Apagatā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmā dhammavinayā, na ca te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjanti.
segments.en: They’ve left this teaching and training, and they don’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.

segments.pli: Ye ca kho te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū nikkuhā nillapā dhīrā atthaddhā susamāhitā, te kho me, bhikkhave, bhikkhū māmakā.
segments.en: But those mendicants who are genuine, not flatterers, wise, amenable, and serene: they are mendicants of mine.

segments.pli: Anapagatā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmā dhammavinayā.
segments.en: They haven’t left this teaching and training,

segments.pli: Te ca imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjantīti.
segments.en: and they achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
Those who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, and frauds,
these don’t grow in the teaching
that was taught by the perfected Buddha.
But those who are genuine, not flatterers, wise,
these do grow in the teaching
that was taught by the perfected Buddha.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, those mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds,…

suttaplex.blurb: Mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds, insolent, and scattered: they are no mendicants of the Buddha.
